comments.body: This is going to take an awfully long time to fail, especially on a large cluster?  Can we wait for them in parallel or something.  Happy to defer that to a separate PR if you prefer.
There is currently only one Kibana pod.
As per discussion, there really is only one pod here, so LGTM.
But the user could change the config to make more (to service lots of users) -- this test would still work regardless of how many Kibana UI pods were made.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +72,76 @@	pods, err := f.Client.Pods(api.NamespaceSystem).List(label, fields.Everything())
	Expect(err).NotTo(HaveOccurred())
	for _, pod := range pods.Items {
		err = waitForPodRunningInNamespace(f.Client, pod.Name, api.NamespaceSystem)
		Expect(err).NotTo(HaveOccurred())
